an4.68:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain, not long after Devadatta had left.
an4.68:4.2: There the Buddha spoke to the mendicants about Devadatta:
an4.68:4.3: “Possessions, honor, and popularity came to Devadatta for his own ruin and downfall.
an4.68:7.1: or a reed, all of which bear fruit to their own ruin and downfall …
an4.68:8.1: It’s like a mule, which becomes pregnant to its own ruin and downfall.
an4.68:8.2: In the same way, possessions, honor, and popularity came to Devadatta for his own ruin and downfall.”
an4.68:9.1: “The banana tree is destroyed by its own fruit,
an4.68:9.2: as are the bamboo and the reed.
